formula.name: IsValidPartyIdentification
formula.description: Returns "True" if the given field value contains the codes specified by the meta string and the code values conform to their respective formats.

formula.name: IsValidBICInPartyIdentification
formula.description: Returns "True" if the BIC value given in Party Identification is well formed and it exists in the BIC directory.

formula.name: IsValidBICInPartyIdentification
formula.description: Returns "True" if the BIC value given in Party Identification is well formed and it exists in the BIC directory.

formula.name: IsValidBICUsingIBANDirectory
formula.description: The purpose is to validate that the BIC is a valid BIC. This can for example be useful in situations when the ordering customer attempted to derive the BIC itself from financial institution's name and address.

formula.name: IsBICNotBEIInPartyIdentification
formula.description: Returns "True" if the given Party Identification value's BIC is not a BEI, ie must not be of subtype BEID, MCCO, TRCO ,SMDP or CORP .

formula.name: VerifyField72NarrativeText
formula.description: Verifies Narrative subfield of Field 72.

formula.name: VerifyT67_T93Format
formula.description: Verifies Narrative Structured Text subfield.

formula.name: VerifyFormat
formula.description: Verifies whether the value conforms to the swift format (requires swift plugin).

formula.name: ParseFormat
formula.description: Parses the value as per the format specified and returns a list (string) of values(requires swift plugin).

formula.name: MatchFormat
formula.description: Matches the value with to the swift format (requires swift plugin).

formula.name: IsISOCurrencyCode
formula.description: Returns "True" if the given string is a valid ISO currency code based on the ISO 4217 standard

formula.name: GetCurrencyCode
formula.description: Returns ISO currency code given currency name. If invalid name is given then this function returns empty string.

formula.name: GetCurrencyName
formula.description: Returns ISO currency name given currency code. If invalid code is given then this function returns empty string

formula.name: GetCurrencyDecimals
formula.description: Returns number of allowed decimal digits for ISO currency code. If invalid code is given then this function returns -1

formula.name: IsISOCountryCode
formula.description: Returns "True" if the given string is a valid ISO country code element based on the ISO 3166 standard

formula.name: GetCountryCode
formula.description: Returns country code if given the official short name. In case an invalid name is given this function returns empty string

formula.name: IsValidDecimals
formula.description: Returns true if the decimal length of the amount is less than or equal to the maximum allowed for the currency.

formula.name: IsValidDecimals
formula.description: Returns true if the decimal length of the amount is less than or equal to the maximum allowed for the currency.

formula.name: IsValidDecimals
formula.description: Returns true if the decimal length of the amount is less than or equal to the maximum allowed for the currency.

formula.name: IsValidDecimals
formula.description: Returns true if the decimal length of the amount is less than or equal to the maximum allowed for the currency.

formula.name: IsSwiftCharSetN
formula.description: Returns true if string conforms to SWIFT charset n.

formula.name: IsSwiftCharSetA
formula.description: Returns true if string conforms to SWIFT charset a.

formula.name: IsSwiftCharSetC
formula.description: Returns true if string conforms to SWIFT charset c.

formula.name: IsSwiftCharSetH
formula.description: Returns true if string conforms to SWIFT charset h.

formula.name: IsSwiftCharSetX
formula.description: Returns true if string conforms to SWIFT charset x.

formula.name: IsSwiftCharSetY
formula.description: Returns true if string conforms to SWIFT charset y.

formula.name: IsSwiftCharSetZ
formula.description: Returns true if string conforms to SWIFT charset z.

formula.name: IsSwiftCharSet15D
formula.description: Returns true if string conforms to SWIFT format 15d

formula.name: IsSwiftCharSet15D
formula.description: Returns true if the value conforms to SWIFT format 15d

formula.name: IsSwiftCharSet15D
formula.description: Returns true if the value conforms to SWIFT format 15d

formula.name: GetCountryName
formula.description: Returns official short name if a valid country code is given. In case country code is invalid this function returns empty string

formula.name: IsValidBIC
formula.description: Returns true if the BIC is well formed and it exists in the BIC directory.

formula.name: IsValidBEI
formula.description: Returns true if the BIC is well formed and it is present in the BIC directory as a BEI.

formula.name: ConstructIBAN
formula.description: Returns IBAN using countrycode, nationalid and accountnumber.

formula.name: GetBICName
formula.description: Returns the name of specified BIC or empty string, if the BIC is invalid.

formula.name: GetBICAddress
formula.description: Returns the address of specified BIC or empty string, if the BIC is invalid.

formula.name: GetBICSubType
formula.description: Returns the subtype of specified BIC or empty string, if the BIC is invalid.

formula.name: GetBICInfos
formula.description: [Deprecated]Returns all or subset of BIC Info objects. The category is an implementation dependent name which canbe used to select a subset of BICs

formula.name: GetBICInfo
formula.description: Returns the BIC Info object (or null) for the given BIC.

formula.name: IsBICNotBEI
formula.description: Returns true if the BIC is not a BEI , ie must not be of subtype BEID, MCCO, TRCO ,SMDP or CORP .

formula.name: IsTimeOffset
formula.description: Returns true if timeOffset is expressed as 'HHMM', where the hour component, ie, 'HH', must be in the range of 00 through 13, and the minute component, ie, 'MM' must be in the range of 00 through 59. Any 'HH' or 'MM' component outside of these range checks will be disallowed.

formula.name: IsSwiftXString
formula.description: Enforces the rule that the string (str) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. If the string has multiple lines, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26).

formula.name: IsISOIBAN
formula.description: Returns "True" if the given string is a valid IBAN based on the Europeon Committee for Banking Standards (ECBS) standard.

formula.name: IsIBANCountry
formula.description: Returns "True" if country is in the IBAN country list.

formula.name: GetIBAN
formula.description: Returns IBAN based on given country code and BBAN. If invalid name is given then this function returns empty string.

formula.name: GetPaperIBAN
formula.description: Returns paper form of the the given ElectronicIBAN.

formula.name: GetElectronicIBAN
formula.description: Returns electronic form of the the given PaperIBAN.

formula.name: GetIBANCountryCode
formula.description: Returns country code (first two characters) in specfied IBAN.

formula.name: GetBBANPart
formula.description: Returns BBAN part in specified IBAN. The returned BBAN will not contain spaces or other non-aplha numeric characters in it.

formula.name: GetBICBankCode
formula.description: Returns bank code part (4!a) in specified BIC, or empty string if the BIC is illformed..

formula.name: GetBICCountryCode
formula.description: Returns country code part (2!a) in specified BIC, or empty string if the BIC is illformed..

formula.name: GetBICLocationCode
formula.description: Returns location code part (2!c) in specified BIC, or empty string if the BIC is illformed.

formula.name: GetBICBranchCode
formula.description: Returns branch code part (3!c) in specified BIC, or empty string if branch is not available.

formula.name: ExtractNonZeroDigits
formula.description: Given a decimal value and the number of digits to be extracted (count), it returns the rightmost non-zero digit preceded by 'count'-1 digits to the left of it. If there are no digits to the left of it, the space is zero filled. This function supports a maximum of 15 digits including both integer and fraction parts.

formula.name: ExtractNonZeroDigits
formula.description: Given a decimal value and the number of digits to be extracted (count), it returns the rightmost non-zero digit preceded by 'count'-1 digits to the left of it. If there are no digits to the left of it, the space is zero filled. This function supports a maximum of 15 digits including both integer and fraction parts.

formula.name: VerifyCopyOfFieldsSyntax
formula.description: Given the 'Copy of fields' value (fieldValue), it validates the syntax of the constituent fields.

formula.name: GetCodeValueSection
formula.description: Returns a section named 'Codes'. Each of its elements has Code and Value fields corresponding to each code and its value pair in the given field value.

formula.name: IsSwiftDate
formula.description: Returns 'true' if the given string value can be converted to date with specified format based on the Swift specification for dates.

formula.name: IsSwiftDate
formula.description: Returns 'true' if the given string value can be converted to date with specified format based on the Swift specification for dates.

formula.name: ParseSwiftDate
formula.description: Returns the equivalent Date object for the given date string based on the Swift specification for dates. The date string is converted to a Date object based on the given pattern. If the pattern is not specified, then the date string should be in the form "Jan 25, 2002".

formula.name: FormatSwiftDate
formula.description: Returns date string for the given date based on the Swift specification for dates. This function formats the given date based on the given pattern and returns the resultant string. When the pattern is not specified, the return string will be of form "Jan 25, 2002".

formula.name: IdentifySWIFTMessage
formula.description: Identifies a SWIFT message

formula.name: IdentifySWIFTMessage
formula.description: Identifies a SWIFT message

formula.name: IdentifySWIFTMessage
formula.description: Identifies a SWIFT message

formula.name: ApplyERIValidation
formula.description: Returns false if the currency is a European currency and the date is after the ERI cut off date (31-12-2001). That is it ensures that European currency is not used after the ERI cutoff date.

formula.name: ApplyERICodeValidation
formula.description: Checks whether ERI codes in narrative or structured fields is a per the ERI conventions. Specifically check is made to ensure tht values for /OCMT/ and /CHGS/ are as per ERI code recommendations

formula.name: ApplyERICodeValidation
formula.description: Checks whether ERI codes in narrative or structured fields is a per the ERI conventions. Specifically check is made to ensure tht values for /OCMT/ and /CHGS/ are as per ERI code recommendations

formula.name: ApplyERICodeValidationStructured
formula.description: Checks whether ERI codes in narrative or structured fields is a per the ERI conventions. Specifically check is made to ensure tht values for /OCMT/ and /CHGS/ are as per ERI code recommendations

formula.name: ApplyERICodeValidationUnstructured
formula.description: Checks whether ERI codes in narrative or structured fields is a per the ERI conventions. Specifically check is made to ensure tht values for /OCMT/ and /CHGS/ are as per ERI code recommendations

formula.name: GetBankDirectoryPlusFromBIC
formula.description: Returns the BankDirectoryPlus Info object (or null) for the given BIC. The parameter 'bic' must be 11 characters (bic code + branch code).

formula.name: GetBankDirectoryPlusFromNationalId
formula.description: Returns the BankDirectoryPlus for a given countryCode and uniqueNationalId.

formula.name: GetBankDirectoryPlusEntriesFromNationalId
formula.description: Returns the BankDirectoryPlus for a given countryCode and uniqueNationalId.

formula.name: GetBankDirectoryPlusFromChipsId
formula.description: Returns the BankDirectoryPlus for a given chips id.

formula.name: GetServiceDirectoryFromChipsId
formula.description: Returns the ServiceDirectory Info object (or null) for the given ChipsId.

formula.name: GetServiceDirectoryFromBIC
formula.description: Returns the ServiceDirectory Info object (or null) for the given BIC. The parameter 'bic' must be 11 characters (bic code + branch code).

formula.name: GetServiceDirectoryFromNationalId
formula.description: Returns the Service Directory object for a given countryCode and uniqueNationalId.

formula.name: GetReachPlusFromChipsId
formula.description: Returns the REACH PLUS Info object (or null) for the given ChipsId.

formula.name: GetReachPlusFromBIC
formula.description: Returns the REACH PLUS Info object (or null) for the given BIC. The parameter 'bic' must be 11 characters (bic code + branch code).

formula.name: GetReachPlusFromNationalId
formula.description: Returns the REACH PLUS object for a given countryCode and uniqueNationalId.

formula.name: GetHolidayInfo
formula.description: Returns the Holiday object for a given countryCode and Date.

formula.name: IsCountryHoliday
formula.description: Returns 1 if the given date for the country specified is a holiday else 0. If holiday directory is not present returns -1

formula.name: GetHolidayServicesInfo
formula.description: Returns the HolidayService object for a given serviceCode and Date.

formula.name: IsServiceHoliday
formula.description: Returns 1 if the given date for the serviceCode specified is a holiday else 0. If directory is not available returns -1

formula.name: GetTimeZoneDifference
formula.description: Retuns the time zone difference from GMT for a given countryCode, region code and Date.

formula.name: GetBICPlusIBAN
formula.description: Returns the BICPlusIBAN Info object (or null) for the given BIC.

formula.name: GetBICPlusIBAN
formula.description: Returns the BICPlusIBAN Info object (or null) for the given BIC.

formula.name: DeriveBICFromIBAN
formula.description: Returns BICPlusIBAN record for the given IBAN. The purpose is to derive the BIC from the IBAN. This can be useful in situations where the IBAN is present but the BIC is missing in a SEPA payment instruction.

formula.name: IsValidBankID
formula.description: The purpose is to validate that the Bank ID contained in an IBAN is a valid Bank ID. This can be useful in situations where the ordering customer has constructed the IBAN. However, the validation does not guarantee that the IBAN itself is valid.

formula.name: IsValidBICIBAN
formula.description: The purpose is to validate that the BIC and the IBAN belong to one and the same institution.

formula.name: IsSEPARoutingOperational
formula.description: The purpose of validating a BIC's operational readiness is to ensure that a BIC is ready to receive SEPA payment instructions for a particular scheme. This can be useful to check the institution's operational readiness for the SEPA schemes before accepting a SEPA credit transfer or SEPA direct debit payment instruction.

formula.name: IsBICAdherent
formula.description: The purpose of validating a BIC's adherence status is to confirm that an institution has signed an adherence agreement for a particular scheme, and is published in the EPC Register of Participants (that is, the adherence database). This validation can be useful for sending banks that want to have additional assurance that the counterpart bank is adherent to the scheme rulebooks.

formula.name: GetAvailablePaymentChannels
formula.description: The purpose is to list the different payment channels through which an institution is directly or indirectly reachable. This will be useful when determining the different routing options and when selecting the optimal channel for sending the payment instruction to the counterpart bank.

formula.name: GetPreferredChannel
formula.description: The purpose is to determine whether the counterpart bank has specified a preferred payment channel for receiving payment instructions. This will be useful if there are multiple routing options available to reach the counterpart bank, and the sending bank is willing to consider the routing preferences specified by the counterpart bank.

formula.name: GetOtherPaymentChannels
formula.description: The purpose is to identify the other payment channels of an intermediary institution used by the institution for reachability through a payment channel. This is useful if the sending bank has no relationship with the payment channel through which the counterpart bank is indirectly reachable. It is also useful to determine alternative routing options if there is no matching payment channel in which both the sending bank and the receiving bank are reachable.

formula.name: VerifyPartyIdentifier
formula.description: Verifies that Party Identifier contains correct country code and format combination

formula.name: VerifyPartyIdentifier
formula.description: Verifies that Party Identifier contains correct country code and format combination

formula.name: Verify50FPartyIdFormat
formula.description: Checks Party Identifier is in format of /34x (Account) || 4!a/2!a/27x

formula.name: Verify50FPartyIdCode
formula.description: Checks whether Party Identifier is used with following code ARNU, CCPT, CUST, DRLC, EMPL, NIDN, SOSE, TXID

formula.name: Verify50FNmandAdrFormat
formula.description: To check whether Lines 2-5 (subfield Name Address) are in the format of "1!n/33x" (Number)(Details)

formula.name: Verify50FNmAndAdrLines2
formula.description: Returns true if the Name and Address satisfy the Line formatting rules specified in SWIFT spec

formula.name: Verify50FNmAndAdrLines
formula.description: Returns true if the Name and Address satisfy the Line formatting rules specified in SWIFT spec

formula.name: Verify50FPartyIdCountryCode
formula.description: Checks whether Country Code used with Party Identifier in the format (Code)(Country Code)(Identifier) is a valid ISO country code

formula.name: Verify50FNmAndAdrDate
formula.description: Verifies if line /4 of NameAddress is followed by a valid date with format YYYYMMDD

formula.name: Verify50FNmAndAdrCtryCode2
formula.description: Verifies if NameAddress Number is starts with the number 3, 5, 6 and 7, then it must be followed by a valid ISO country code

formula.name: Verify50FNmAndAdrCtryCode
formula.description: Verifies if NameAddress Number is starts with the number 3, 5, 6 and 7, then it must be followed by a valid ISO country code

formula.name: Verify59FNmAndAdrDtlFormat
formula.description: To check whether Lines 2-5 (subfield Name And Address Details) are in the format of "1!n/33x" (Number)(Name and Address Details)

formula.name: Verify59FNmAndAdrDtlLines
formula.description: Returns true if the 'Name and Address Details' satisfy the Line formatting rules specified in SWIFT spec for field 59F

formula.name: Verify59FNmAndAdrDtlCtryCode
formula.description: Verifies if 'Name and Address Details' Number starts with the number 3. If so, then it must be followed by a valid ISO country code

formula.name: parseDelimitedRecord
formula.description: Parses tab separated record [for internal use]

formula.name: parseDelimitedHeaderRecord
formula.description: Parses tab separated header record [for internal use]
